cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes or the exposure of sensitive information.
explanation: The code snippet is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read. The function get_termcode checks if the input index i is greater than or equal to tc_len but does not check if i is less than zero. If a negative value is passed for i, it will result in an out-of-bounds access to the termcodes array, leading to a read from an invalid memory location.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The code snippet is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read. The function get_termcode takes an integer i as an index. While it checks for i >= tc_len to prevent accessing beyond the end of the termcodes array, it does not check if i is negative. If a negative value is passed for i, it will result in an array index underflow, attempting to access memory before the start of the termcodes array, leading to an out-of-bounds read.
